* Zyber came up to Rowdy Wolf slowly but stopped a foot or two from him, her head still a bit low but rising a bit. Her ears slowly swiveled forward and became straight again, listening to the tempo and time between each one of his breaths.
Her head turned to the side so that she was looking at him by her left eyes, judging his stance as her instinct instructed her to.
Zyber then straightened her head out to look at him but kept her head low, the sign of respect and no harm still in her posture.
She took a few steps towards him but stopped just in case he took it the wrong way, then raising her head and looking around cautiously. Her ears erect and turning this way that that, catching sounds off in the distance but nothing threatening.
With a satisfied sigh she then looked back towards Rowdy Wolf and took another step towards him, then lowering her head a bit but not as much as before.
Zyber looked away from him for a moment, resisting the urge to lick him on the face. A common action for wolves, simply licking each other's faces to say hello and to strengthen their bonds with each other.
But she knew that if she did that Rowdy would either snap at her or push her out of the way, probably not liking any such signs as that.
But she then looked back towards him, her eyes glowing blue in the black night.
Zyber's voice was nothing more then a sound in the night, just as quiet as the wind but enough so that Rowdy could hear her.*

" May I join you back to you den?"

* Her white coat shining like moon light against the still surface of a lake, giving her that ghost-like appearance again.
She waited quietly.*
